00036 using namespace std;

00040 static set < string > plugin_files;
00041 static set < pair < string, string > >functions;
00042 static set < pair < string, string> > excluded_functions;
00043 static vector<void *> handles;
00044 
00045 /* Parse a plugins.active file */
00046 static void parse_config(const char *const pa_path)
00047 {
00048   FILE *plugins = fopen(pa_path, "r");
00049 
00050   if (0 == plugins) {
00051     fprintf(stderr,
00052             "Error opening plugin configuration file (plugins.active)."
00053             "  I'll let you continue, but you'll have no hooks.\n");
00054     return;
00055   }
00056 
00057   char buf[1024];
00058   int line_no = 1;
00059   int mode = -1;
00060 
00061   fgets(buf, 1024, plugins);
00062   while (!feof(plugins)) {
00063 
00064     if (buf[strlen(buf) - 1] != '\n') {
00065       fprintf(stderr,
00066               "WW: Line %d in plugin config file is too long and has"
00067               "been truncated.\n", line_no);
00068     }
00069 
00070     /* if line contains comment character, remove rest of line */
00071     char *semi = strchr(buf, ';');
00072     if (0 != semi)
00073       *semi = '\0';
00074 
00075     int blank = 1;
00076     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < strlen(buf); ++i) {
00077       if (buf[i] != ' ' && buf[i] != '\t' && buf[i] != '\n') {
00078         blank = 0;
00079       }
00080     }
00081     if (1 == blank)
00082       goto next;
00083 
00084     char token[512];
00085     if (1 != sscanf(buf, " %s ", token)) {
00086       fprintf(stderr, "EE: Syntax error on line %d of plugin config file."
00087               " I'll pretend like it didn't happen.\n", line_no);
00088 
00089       goto next;
00090     }
00091 
00092   if (!strcmp(token, ".plugins:")) {
00093     mode = 0;
00094   }
00095   else if (!strcmp(token, ".functions:")) {
00096     mode = 1;
00097   }
00098   else if (!strcmp(token, ".excluded_functions:")) {
00099     mode = 2;
00100   }
00101   else {
00102     if (0 == mode) {
00103     plugin_files.insert(token);
00104     }
00105     else if (1 == mode || 2== mode) {
00106     char module[256];
00107     char function[256];
00108 
00109     char *first_colon = strchr(token, ':');
00110     char *second_colon = strrchr(token, ':');
00111     if (0 == first_colon || 0 == second_colon ||
00112       (first_colon + 1 != second_colon)) {
00113       fprintf(stderr,
00114         "EE: Syntax error on line %d of plugin config file."
00115         " I'll pretend like it didn't happen.\n", line_no);
00116       fprintf(stderr, "buf: '%s'\ntoken: '%s'\n", buf, token);
00117       goto next;
00118     }
00119 
00120     *first_colon = '\0';
00121     strcpy(module, token);
00122     strcpy(function, second_colon + 1);
00123 
00124     if(1== mode)
00125       functions.insert(pair < string, string > (module, function));
00126     else
00127       excluded_functions.insert(pair < string, string > (module, function));
00128     }
00129     else {
00130     fprintf(stderr,
00131       "EE: When the first non-comment line I read isn't a"
00132       " modeline, i get terribly confused. See sample.\n");
00133     fclose(plugins);
00134     return;
00135     }
00136   }
00137 
00138 next:
00139   ++line_no;
00140   fgets(buf, 1024, plugins);
00141   }
00142 
00143   fprintf(stderr, "Files to load as plugins:\n");
00144   for (set < string >::iterator it = plugin_files.begin();
00145     it != plugin_files.end(); ++it) {
00146   fprintf(stderr, "\t%s\n", it->c_str());
00147   }
00148 
00149   fprintf(stderr, "Module/function pairs to load:\n");
00150   for (set < pair < string, string > >::iterator it = functions.begin();
00151     it != functions.end(); ++it) {
00152   fprintf(stderr, "\t%s::%s\n", it->first.c_str(), it->second.c_str());
00153   }
00154 
00155   fclose(plugins);
00156 }
00157 
00158 #ifdef PLUGIN_TRACECAP
00159 /* Parse an ini file containing hook information */
00160 static void parse_plugin_ini(const char *file_name)
00161 {
00162   struct cnfnode *cn_root, *cn_node;
00163   struct cnfmodule *mod_ini;
00164   struct cnfresult *cnf_res;
00165   char module[256];
00166   char function[256];
00167 
00168   register_ini(NULL);
00169   mod_ini = find_cnfmodule("ini");
00170   cn_root = cnfmodule_parse_file(mod_ini, file_name);
00171 
00172   cnf_res = cnf_find_entry(cn_root, "hook plugins");
00173   if(cnf_res) {
00174     for(cn_node = cnf_res->cnfnode->first_child; cn_node != NULL; cn_node = cn_node->next) {
00175       if(cn_node->value && !strcasecmp(cn_node->value, "yes"))
00176         plugin_files.insert(cn_node->name);
00177     }
00178   }
00179 
00180   cnf_res = cnf_find_entry(cn_root, "functions");
00181   if(cnf_res) {
00182     for(cn_node = cnf_res->cnfnode->first_child; cn_node != NULL; cn_node = cn_node->next) {
00183       char *first_colon = strchr(cn_node->name, ':');
00184           char *second_colon = strrchr(cn_node->name, ':');
00185       if (0 == first_colon || 0 == second_colon ||
00186                   (first_colon + 1 != second_colon)) {
00187                 //fprintf(stderr, " Syntax error: %s \n", cn_node->name);
00188                 continue;
00189       }
00190 
00191       *first_colon = '\0';
00192           strcpy(module, cn_node->name);
00193           strcpy(function, second_colon + 1);
00194 
00195       if(cn_node->value && !strcasecmp(cn_node->value, "yes"))
00196         functions.insert(pair < string, string > (module, function));
00197       else
00198         excluded_functions.insert(pair < string, string > (module, function));
00199     }
00200   }
00201 
00202   term_printf("Files to load as plugins:\n");
00203   for (set < string >::iterator it = plugin_files.begin();
00204           it != plugin_files.end(); ++it) {
00205         term_printf("\t%s\n", it->c_str());
00206   }
00207 
00208   term_printf("Module/function pairs to load:\n");
00209   for (set < pair < string, string > >::iterator it = functions.begin();
00210           it != functions.end(); ++it) {
00211         term_printf("\t%s::%s\n", it->first.c_str(), it->second.c_str());
00212   }
00213 
00214   destroy_cnftree(cn_root);
00215 }
00216 #endif
00217 
00218 
00219 /*
00220 ** This function will find all plugin (*.so) files in the pl_path directory
00221 ** that are specified in the plugins.active file.
00222 ** All plugins will then have init_plugin called in them.
00223 ** Each plugin is responsible for adding the appropriate hooks.
00224 */
00225 void load_hook_plugins(unsigned int *mon_cr3, /* cr3 of proc to monitor */
00226                        const char *const pa_path, /* path of plugins.active */
00227                        const char *const pl_path, /* path of plugins */
00228                        hook_plugin_info_t * plugin_info,
00229            enum confType file_type)
00230 
00231 {
00232   /* load hook plugins */
00233   plugin_info->proc_cr3 = mon_cr3;
00234   if (file_type == pactive)
00235     parse_config(pa_path);
00236 #ifdef PLUGIN_TRACECAP
00237   else
00238     parse_plugin_ini(pa_path);
00239 #endif
00240 
00241   set < string >::iterator it = plugin_files.begin();
00242   for (; it != plugin_files.end(); ++it) {
00243     printf("Loading %s:: ", it->c_str());
00244     char path[512];
00245     char *error = 0;
00246     sprintf(path, "%s/%s", pl_path, it->c_str());
00247 
00248     dlerror();
00249     void *handle = dlopen(path, RTLD_NOW);
00250     if (0 != (error = dlerror())) {
00251       printf("error: %s\n", error);
00252     }
00253     else {
00254       init_plugin_t init_plugin = (init_plugin_t)dlsym(handle, "init_plugin");
00255 
00256       if (0 != (error = dlerror())) {
00257         printf("error initializing: %s\n", error);
00258       }
00259       else {
00260         init_plugin(plugin_info);
00261         handles.push_back(handle);
00262       }
00263     }
00264   }
00265 }
00266 
00267 /**
00268  * This function unloads all the hook plugins
00269  */
00270 void unload_hook_plugins()
00271 {
00272   for(uint32_t i=0; i<handles.size(); i++) {
00273     //unload it
00274   
00275     dlclose(handles[i]);
00276   }
00277   
00278   handles.clear();
00279 }

00283 /*
00284 ** this function is provided to hooks to allow them to check which functions
00285 ** the configuration file has requested they hook
00286 */
00287 int should_hook(const char *const mod_name, const char *const fun_name)
00288 {
00289   if (excluded_functions.find(pair < string, string > (mod_name, fun_name)) !=
00290       excluded_functions.end())
00291     return 0;
00292 
00293   if (excluded_functions.find(pair < string, string > (mod_name, "*")) !=
00294       excluded_functions.end())
00295     return 0;
00296 
00297   if (excluded_functions.find(pair < string, string > ("*", fun_name)) !=
00298       excluded_functions.end())
00299     return 0;
00300 
00301   if (excluded_functions.find(pair < string, string > ("*", "*")) !=
00302       excluded_functions.end())
00303     return 0;
00304 
00305   
00306   if (functions.find(pair < string, string > (mod_name, fun_name)) !=
00307       functions.end())
00308     return 1;
00309 
00310   if (functions.find(pair < string, string > (mod_name, "*")) !=
00311       functions.end())
00312     return 1;
00313 
00314   if (functions.find(pair < string, string > ("*", fun_name)) !=
00315       functions.end())
00316     return 1;
00317 
00318   if (functions.find(pair < string, string > ("*", "*")) !=
00319       functions.end())
00320     return 1;
00321 
00322   return 0;
00323 }
